summary: This document set pertains to the sale of a Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter (tail number N722JE) from Hyperion Air, LLC to Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC in May 2021. It includes a tax exemption affidavit, a purchase agreement amendment, a delivery receipt, and FAA registration inquiries, detailing the financial and legal steps of the transaction. This document is a series of administrative search results from the Aircraft Document Control System and Aircraft Registration System, dated May 13, 2021. It details searches for records related to aircraft N-Number 722JE, a Sikorsky S-76 helicopter, and associated engines, showing international registry filings and assignments from 2008 to 2019. This document set contains FAA forms, bills of sale, and related paperwork for the transfer of a Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter (N722JE) from Hyperion Air LLC to Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC in May 2021. It details the sale price, registration, and an affidavit for Florida sales tax exemption, indicating the aircraft was removed from Florida. This document set contains emails, invoices, legal agreements, and closing documents related to the sale of a Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter (tail number N722JE, serial number 760750) from Hyperion Air, LLC (owned by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein) to Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC in May 2021. It details the escrow process, amendments to the purchase agreement, payment of outstanding invoices, and final disbursement of sale proceeds to the Epstein estate.

persons.name: Melissa Koboldt

persons.name: Rich Munkvold
persons.context: Signatory for the purchaser, Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC, on the cover letter, the Second Amendment to the Aircraft Purchase Agreement, and the Delivery Receipt for the helicopter.

persons.context: Represents the seller (Hyperion Air, LLC, owned by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein) in the aircraft sale transaction. Provides wire instructions for the estate, reviews and approves closing documents.

persons.context: Manager for the seller Hyperion Air, LLC, provides hangar invoices and wiring instructions, signs closing documents digitally.

persons.name: Richard Munkvold

connections.description: Parties to a contract for the sale of an aircraft; Munkvold represented the purchaser and Indyke represented the seller.
Munkvold corresponded with Koboldt to submit a tax exemption affidavit related to the aircraft purchase.
Visoski is the Manager who signed documents on behalf of the selling company, Hyperion Air LLC.
Munkvold is the CFO who signed documents on behalf of Frontier Finance Co, a member of the purchasing entity.
Previti is listed as an individual member of the purchasing Limited Liability Company.
Seller and purchaser in a transaction for a Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter.
Indyke acts as the attorney and authorized representative for Hyperion Air, LLC, which is solely owned by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein.
Indyke, as the seller's representative, directs Visoski (manager of Hyperion Air) to sign closing documents.
Anzalone, as broker, communicates with Munkvold (buyer's CFO) regarding deal terms, extensions, and closing.
Anzalone coordinates with Indyke (seller's attorney) on closing logistics and document approval.
Escrow agent and seller's attorney correspond extensively to finalize closing documents, disbursements, and logistics.
Visoski corresponds with Stablein (Sikorsky) regarding an outstanding invoice for aircraft parts/services to be paid from sale proceeds.

events.title: Execution of Second Amendment
events.description: Hyperion Air, LLC and Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC sign a Second Amendment to the Aircraft Purchase Agreement, extending the closing deadline to May 13, 2021, and making an increased deposit non-refundable.

events.title: Aircraft Closing Date
events.description: The absolute final date by which the purchaser, Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC, must close on the purchase of the Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter (N722JE) from Hyperion Air, LLC.

events.title: Tax Exemption Affidavit Date
events.description: Date listed on the Florida tax exemption affidavit for the aircraft purchase, claiming the aircraft will be removed from Florida within 10 days.

events.title: Assignment of N-Number for 722JE
events.description: Assignment of N-Number documents were accepted for aircraft N-Number 722JE.

events.title: Assignment Letter and Memo to File for 722JE
events.description: An assignment letter and a memo to file were accepted for aircraft N-Number 722JE.

events.title: Miscellaneous Support Document Accepted
events.description: A miscellaneous support document was accepted for aircraft N-Number 722JE.

events.title: Evidence of Ownership Filed
events.description: Evidence of ownership was filed for aircraft N-Number 722JE.

events.title: International Registry Filing for S-76 (750A)
events.description: An international registry filing (IRN20081230154204) was made for a Sikorsky S-76 with serial number 760750, under N-Number 750A.

events.title: International Registry Filing for 722JE
events.description: An international registry filing (IRN20110726120229) was made for aircraft N-Number 722JE, a Sikorsky S-76 with serial 760750, and for engine serial 42285.

events.title: International Registry Filing for 722JE and Keystone Helicopter
events.description: An international registry filing (IRN20190613101517) was made for aircraft N-Number 722JE, identified as a 'KEYSTONE HELICOPTER S-7' with serial 760750, and for engine serial 42285.

events.title: Aircraft Sale and Registration Submission
events.description: Documents were executed and submitted to the FAA for the sale and registration transfer of helicopter N722JE.

events.title: Aircraft Purchase
events.description: The Aircraft Purchase Agreement was dated, and the sale of the helicopter was completed for $1,800,000.

events.title: Delivery and Acceptance
events.description: Purchaser acknowledged delivery and acceptance of the helicopter at Fort Lauderdale Executive Airport in Florida.

events.title: FAA Registration Issued
events.description: The FAA issued a Certificate of Aircraft Registration for N722JE to Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC.

events.title: Original Aircraft Purchase Agreement Signed
events.description: Hyperion Air, LLC and Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC enter into an agreement for the sale of Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter N722JE.

events.title: First Amendment to Purchase Agreement
events.description: Parties amend the agreement to extend the closing deadline from April 20, 2021, to May 7, 2021.

events.title: Digital Signing of Closing Documents
events.description: Larry Visoski digitally signs the Bill of Sale and Warranty Bill of Sale for the aircraft.

events.title: Closing Extension and Additional Deposit
events.description: Purchaser wires an additional $100,000 as good faith and extends the closing deadline to May 12, 2021.

events.title: Release of $200,000 Deposit to Seller
events.description: Following execution of a second amendment, the $200,000 non-refundable deposit is released to the seller (Estate of Jeffrey Epstein).

events.title: Aircraft Sale Closing
events.description: Final closing occurs. Funds are disbursed from escrow, including proceeds to the Epstein estate, and documents are filed with the FAA.

keyFacts: A Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter (tail number N722JE, serial number 760750) was sold by Hyperion Air, LLC to Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC for $1,800,000 in May 2021.
The purchaser claimed a Florida sales tax exemption by filing an affidavit stating the aircraft would be removed from Florida within 10 days of purchase.
The closing deadline for the purchase was extended to May 13, 2021, contingent on the purchaser making an additional $100,000 non-refundable deposit.
FAA records show the aircraft was registered to Hyperion Air, LLC, a U.S. Virgin Islands company, prior to the 2021 sale.
The document is a log of administrative searches conducted on May 13, 2021, into FAA aircraft registration and international registry systems for records related to N-Number 722JE.
Aircraft N-Number 722JE is identified as a Sikorsky S-76 helicopter with serial number 760750, and is later referred to as a 'KEYSTONE HELICOPTER S-7' in a 2019 filing.
The searches show a history of ownership evidence, assignments, and international registry filings for the helicopter and its engines (serial numbers 42285 and 42286) from 2008 to 2019.
Multiple searches return 'NO RECORDS' or 'NO MATCHES FOUND', indicating gaps or the absence of certain expected documentation in the systems queried.
A Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter (N722JE, serial 760750) was sold by Hyperion Air LLC to Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC for $1,800,000 in May 2021.
The purchasing entity, Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC, is organized in New Mexico and lists James L Previti and Frontier Finance Co as members.
An affidavit claims exemption from Florida sales tax, stating the aircraft would be removed from Florida within 10 days of purchase on May 1, 2021.
The helicopter was delivered and accepted at Fort Lauderdale Executive Airport (KFXE) in an 'As Is, Where Is' condition.
The FAA issued a new Certificate of Aircraft Registration to Industrial Integrity Solutions, LLC on July 30, 2021.
The seller, Hyperion Air, LLC, is identified as being solely owned by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein.
The sale price for the Sikorsky S-76C++ helicopter (N722JE) was $1,800,000.
Proceeds from the sale were wired to a bank account for the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein at First Bank.
The transaction involved paying outstanding invoices from Sikorsky ($1,371.24) and Banyan Air Services ($6,976.50) from the escrow funds.
The deal required a Florida sales tax exemption affidavit because the aircraft was being removed from the state by a non-resident purchaser.
